item.title: Usless BitComet AutoClicker v1.1 by Eager. Anti-PC Sleeping script feed back plz
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

The clicks are off. Because if it can’t find bitcomet, it keeps adding to the clicks.

Move a:= a + 1; and put it into the procedure FindBitcomet and the end. That way if the script finds it the clicks would be accurate.

Read full topic
item.source: Usless BitComet AutoClicker v1.1 by Eager. Anti-PC Sleeping script feed back plz

item.title: Usless BitComet AutoClicker v1.1 by Eager. Anti-PC Sleeping script feed back plz
item.dc:creator: @eagertolearn eagertolearn
item.description:
@eagertolearn wrote:

hi everyone this is my first offical script! Basicly it just click on Bitcomet onence every min so ur pc wouldn’t sleep/shut down. Yes i know that their’s a no sleep option for windows, but i just made this script for fun . Enjoy! Please Post Feed Backs. and Comments Thanks. OO Yeah and please read the instructions. I might upgrade it into if download is 100% then turminate that program or turminate Bitcomet.

[code]{///////////Please Read Before Starting Very Important!!////////////////////////

Program: Usless Bitcomet AutoClicker(first offical script XD).

Author: Eagertolearn.

Published Date: July 20, 2006.

Description: Clicks BitComet Icon + Random MouveMouse, to prevent
you screen from freezing/sleeping so you could download
stuff 24/7 :D.

Recuirements: Have nathing Open except for this and bitcomet. Close everything
else.

Instructions: Only have this (Scar) and bitcomet open,Fill in SET UP. Run
this script :). Next minize this (Scar).And dont do anything until u wanted to stop this.

Note: This Script Moves Mouse onece per min :), before doing anything make
sure u have something to download XD. And Make sure just before when u run this
make sure you could see ur BitComet icon.

History: Version 1.0: First Script pure simple.
Version 1.1: Added Open And Click BitComet procedure, user friendly.
}
program BTDownloadClicker; //Example for Const!
//Color Picked: 13985841 at (197, 738)
//Color Picked: 13196041 at (1023, 767)
//examine those ^^^^ ^^^^
{.include library2.txt}

//-----------------------SET UP!! HERE BELOW------------------------------------
const
wholescreenTopX=0;
wholescreenTopY=0;
wholescreenButtomX=1023;
wholescreenButtomY=767;

TopLeftCornerX=197;//Use Color picker/just movemouse on the top left hand top corner of ur Windows Tool Bar Get the Position.
TopLeftCornerY=738;// Get this position Y coordinate form abouve. ^^^^^^^^^^^^
ButtomRightCornerX=1023;//Get Buttom Right Corner of your tool bar ( very buttom right of ur screen.) X coordinat.
ButtomRightCornerY=767;//Get Buttom Right Corner of your tool bar ( very buttom right of ur screen.) Y coordinat.
//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
// (o.o) Please Dont Touch Below. (o.o)
//--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

var a,rx,ry,randx,randy,bitcomet,time,bitcometwindowico,OpenBt,BTStopIcon,o,ConnectIcon:integer;

procedure load;// load Bitmaps BT icons
begin
bitcomet := BitmapFromString(16, 16, ‘z78DA9594598E1C390C44’ + //Superminzed BT Icon.
‘AFA495CBA7B8DDFF480E166606D3B0D1B6B3015543493D0683548’ +
‘EF1DD53C3AF45490CD7F2B038F5DCFDD47CFE461C518EF1974F2D’ +
‘672BD022A4B2A84EFDFC4431DE589057AD377478F1A1F31B32B9F’ +
‘8C0D9954DD835BFF0B31C7F59AF3AAFE13732B3D797B7B6998D20’ +
‘BAF757E469F2701EF186F8FAAC865359339BB9F23F7206F623391’ +
‘01315B71CC619CE4A82E3D3D8FDC2BA2F7CF36382533887754413’ +
‘28C0CC17501EEA1B7C464D0871AF707AE7A37C94DBD6852C07A1D’ +
‘EB5A4CAA57FFA02005A07B7B39958E10F689FFFDD400B7433FD81’ +
‘96A80B6B98C3377BD24AB62772E9837E6C1874CEC785AC212ED7C’ +
‘EAAFD96C4A79B20BBD90479D86ACD06FD3E05599C155EE5F96474’ +
‘7BE0A3D0CFFEC03EB54B1A173D1143BB5048EC1817E98B8569955’ +
‘9BEAE74C92A18ABCD2FEB46ACDB1C97FAF07B3F3A3B46076F5F5D’ +
‘F06BA02ED73C017E1E2AD64523164FEC6C9E3B4B450E66420B1AC’ +
‘284A13C9642EDD3CD1F7EEB5C46CD7FBD3369367F07F6355ADBA4’ +
‘5DAA8A8C87E608349C483278A10AE2B308D9657724BA03AF2EC3E’ +
‘D97ABF52314E4A7200709FCF1013D6173B79F8C0EC20196123D67’ +
‘166A1ECB27DBF538B45720238F2A118C31228D37B2E8C584BC0E0’ +
‘EDFA814648627818ADBC3DD3DCD89DE7D94A8291574E6947C37C6’ +
‘D479EFB67FA70815BD3AFCA64243A1227DB4BCECBD895C3E774FF’ +
‘B836FB8D590D23B076F6D2E44E6C1DD7CF7E0CE908FE1EBEEF1FE’ +
‘3FFFB128370AE63BB9AE2E78C2EA0BAADE1AE80BDC003318CA1D7’ +
‘7B4E77021E3333917E4BD0916F2C42C43396CA279F4E75B1C46A8’ +
‘3793EFC04D92D55F0C3D834A5E206527DCF8BE8DADCDC4DB8B666’ +
‘E9013979C9897EAB973E6F75F21CC556C49611EABA61CAC0B624E’ +
‘1D7DF0702BF53750E798D9E3B030A93C5482EED76FC29F3CAEB2C’ +
‘EF584318A1515B50D434CF9AE00930E7D4FF801780C6358’);

bitcometwindowico := BitmapFromString(16, 16, ‘z78DA95944B9’ + //minized BT icon
‘21C310844AFA40F48680908EE7F2427D5ED09DB319EB16B4154AB’ +
‘D15392A06AEDABE7E832F19BA74BA47B334AD3D47E1B0B9324D19’ +
‘AED3F9F639B0E38D67566E4C8967F7BDC8F21858386D014E6AFC9’ +
‘9E7B6CCA088D85DD371D9173E6BF3CFDB898C9B0419F689ECB05C’ +
‘4E8D7901B6047786CBC8F883F48F4B110D7BC625C7E2FA4EE233B’ +
‘26F3F8959F227D69559C28384EC09968CFAE93A8E5B27FB8147A1’ +
‘17C699DBEE0DF5513C9EB61F79D713866BCC8DA39B7E505A1C8FB’ +
‘BEF47444B60FC956D5656A82090C92D4F728F7A2CE1A0712F4480’ +
‘7E7DE8AEAF9F65C995170640B0773F97AC8205C7742415751058C’ +
‘ED00AD6A0834E0DD6EADA0C18F4D95AE739D348C95BE35E16D6AC’ +
‘2A9317122393C71B396F75CD60FE563C11F9F0F9F9D7F46E75AD1’ +
‘36F73BF11E2303FF504FD52DEDD232E25C9BE9A4EC3139AFB11C6’ +
‘42E2AB777F5F1F8289DB41FFD4FF39FE86824F8B3FE4D29973457’ +
‘4BD4C327F79ABDDD2167B9430CEDDC7B43896E437E2901FF5A15A’ +
‘1EBE1772E8B6FB9F18ABE57E9AF7C0C9B969D535ADA09EEF0245B’ +
‘37DEBC267E13F6F2EABDA38ADD4FBA0532C3A5E28B6041C541D58’ +
‘8B50E7F5075A86357B86305DD929A43463EADD13A1C095AEFF96C’ +
‘1840C5FA6E3DCFA3DFB4E2D55504DC9BE2DBC3BFAFD371226606F’ +
‘9B8E9C88410F8437BB6EEC9D4FAAFF32FCAB03FD08C26B92466CB’ +
‘A354BB8E8270CD664DECD948BA09FE7DF8F822C18DF3286189D1F’ +
‘C9633ECD47EBF5FEF59EDABCD16090D524D01794B45D503DFCCF1’ +
‘3903D3B84E2FE5B8AB887C60072E3BAE8138E967DF87DF6A1156F’ +
‘670988DD6CB2C82C4438BDE723D15F1614412BC3BBEB1D0ACC49F’ +
‘69FEE6AC8621206B6B0DBA6DC355C7BD6D5DDB6A835627FD8EF90’ +
‘31AA362F1’);

OpenBT := DTMFromString(‘78DA632C656060F8CF8002FEFF87083042F98’ +
‘C0D40821BC263828AFD9DEDC86084AC261B480820D43021990757’ +
‘5305247EA28A7DF43764104156930624581951D4FCC8B641B10B0’ +
‘03AD70CCC’);

BTStopIcon := DTMFromString(‘78DA639CCAC0C0A0C9C8800C962C5902A661A’ +
‘28C1380841E238A58717131980D573313538D939313AA39D38184’ +
‘2AAA9A3D7BF6A0AAE907121AA86ACE9C3983C20700432D0C6E’);

ConnectIcon := DTMFromString(‘78DA63BCC0C0C010CBC8800CF2165E01D320D’ +
‘1FF40C07815C88862848B818067CE04066E243EE3694C3545FD6B’ +
‘187890D59C031289A86A141D9318D8A17C26107D85B01A0053021’ +
‘07B’);
end;
//-------------------INCLUDE PROCEDURES-----------------------------------------
procedure OpenBitcomet;
begin
o:= 0;
if(findDTM(OpenBt,rx,ry,wholescreenTopX,wholescreenTopY,WholescreenButtomX,WholescreenButtomY))then
begin
repeat
mouse(rx,ry+2,randx,randy,true);
o:= o + 1;
until(o>1);
writeln(‘Opened Bitcomet icon!!’);
end else
writeln(‘BitComet Already Opened!’);
end;

procedure ClickToStartDownload;
begin
mouse(rx,ry,randx,randy,true);
wait(150);
mouse(rx,ry,randx,randy,true);
writeln(‘Started Downloading!’);
end;
//------------------------------------------------------------------------------
procedure OpenAndClickBT;
begin
if(not(findBitmapin(bitcomet,rx,ry,TopLeftCornerX,TopLeftCornerY,ButtomRightCornerX,ButtomRightCornerY)or findbitmapin(bitcometwindowico,rx,ry,TopLeftCornerX,TopLeftCornerY,ButtomRightCornerX,ButtomRightCornerY)))then
begin
openBitcomet;
Wait(10000 + random(3000));
end
repeat
ClickToStartDownload;
wait(8000 + random(2000));
until(findDTM(ConnectIcon,rx,ry,wholescreenTopX,wholescreenTopY,WholescreenButtomX,WholescreenButtomY));
end;

procedure FindBitcomet;//finds BT and click it onece wait and random movemouse 5x.
begin
OpenAndClickBT;//procedure OpenBT.(above)
a:= 0;
if(findBitmapin(bitcomet,rx,ry,TopLeftCornerX,TopLeftCornerY,ButtomRightCornerX,ButtomRightCornerY)or findbitmapin(bitcometwindowico,rx,ry,TopLeftCornerX,TopLeftCornerY,ButtomRightCornerX,ButtomRightCornerY))then
begin
mouse(rx+8,ry+8,randx,randy,true);//click on BT 1x
a:= a + 1;//a is how many time Scar Clicks BT.
wait(600);
mmouse(random(1000),random(500),random(50),random(50));
wait(300);
mmouse(random(1000),random(500),random(50),random(50));
wait(300);
mmouse(random(1000),random(500),random(50),random(50));
wait(300);
mmouse(random(1000),random(500),random(50),random(50));
wait(300);
mmouse(random(1000),random(500),random(50),random(50))
end else// if there’s error then begin this step.
begin
writeln(‘Problem With The BitMap’);
end;
end;

begin
load;
OpenAndClickBT;
time:= 0;
repeat
wait(58125);
time:= time +1;// Times/ min
FindBitcomet;
cleardebug;
writeln(’(--------------------------------------------------)’);
writeln(’(--------------Worked For: ‘+ inttostr(time)+’ mins!----------------)’);
writeln(’(--------------------------------------------------)’);
writeln(’(---------moved mouse: ‘+ inttostr(a *5)+’ Random times.------------)’);//a=5x random.
writeln(’(--------------------------------------------------)’);
writeln(’(--------Clicked On Bitcomet: ’ + inttostr(a)+ ’ times!------------)’);
writeln(’(--------------------------------------------------)’);
writeln(’(Thank You For Using Bitcomet AutoClicker By Eager.)’);
writeln(’ IF their’'s any problem please let me know (-.-) ');
until(false);
end.[/code]

edit:
Updated it to version 1.1:

  • User dose not need to open Bitcomet anymore! this script opens it by itself.
  • So basicly just do the setup, and run it.

Read full topic
